t: Ezekiel 32
Lamentation for Pharaoh and Egypt
And*p it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month,*i on the first day*i of the month, that*i the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,

“Son of man, take up a lamentation for Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say to him: ‘You*pn are like a young lion among the nations, And*ld you are*i like a monster in the seas, Bursting*ld forth in your rivers, Troubling*ld the waters with your feet, And*ld fouling their rivers.
‘Thus*p says the Lord God:*s “I*pn will therefore spread My net over you with a company of many people, And*ld they will draw you up in My net.
Then*ld I will leave you on the land; I*ld will cast you out on the open fields, And*ld cause to settle on you all the birds of the heavens. And*ld with you I will fill the beasts of the whole earth.
I*ld will lay your flesh on the mountains, And*ld fill the valleys with your carcass.
“I*ln will also water the land with the flow of your blood, Even*ild to the mountains; And*ld the riverbeds will be full of you.
When*ld I*i put out your light, I*ld will cover the heavens, and make its stars dark; I*ld will cover the sun with a cloud, And*ld the moon shall not give her light.
All*ld the bright lights of the heavens I will make dark over you, And*ld bring darkness upon your land,” Says*ld the Lord God.*s
‘I*p will also trouble the hearts of many peoples, when I bring your destruction among the nations, into the countries which you have not known.

Yes, I will make many peoples astonished at you, and their kings shall be horribly afraid of you when I brandish My sword before them; and they shall tremble every*i moment, every man for his own life, in the day of your fall.
‘For*p thus says the Lord God:*s “The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.

By the swords of the mighty warriors, all of them the most terrible of the nations, I will cause your multitude to fall. “They*pn shall plunder the pomp of Egypt, And*ld all its multitude shall be destroyed.
Also*ld I will destroy all its animals From*ld beside its great waters; The*ld foot of man shall muddy them no more, Nor*ld shall the hooves of animals muddy them.
Then*ld I will make their waters clear, And*ld make their rivers run like oil,” Says*ld the Lord God.*s
“When*ln I make the land of Egypt desolate, And*ld the country is destitute of all that once filled it, When*ld I strike all who dwell in it, Then*ld they shall know that I am*i the Lord.*s

“This*ln is*i the lamentation With*ld which they shall lament her; The*ld daughters of the nations shall lament her; They*ld shall lament for her, for Egypt, And*ld for all her multitude,” Says*ld the Lord God.’”*s
Egypt and Others Consigned to the Pit
It*p came to pass also in the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day*i of the month, that*i the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying:
“Son*pn of man, wail over the multitude of Egypt, And*ld cast them down to the depths of the earth, Her*ld and the daughters of the famous nations, With*ld those who go down to the Pit:
‘Whom*ld do you surpass in beauty? Go*ld down, be placed with the uncircumcised.’
“They*ln shall fall in the midst of those*i slain by the sword; She*ld is delivered to the sword, Drawing*ld her and all her multitudes.
The*ld strong among the mighty Shall*ld speak to him out of the midst of hell With*ld those who help him: ‘They*ld have gone down, They*ld lie with the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.’
“Assyria*ln is*i there, and all her company, With*ld their graves all around her, All*ld of them slain, fallen by the sword.
Her*ld graves are set in the recesses of the Pit, And*ld her company is all around her grave, All*ld of them slain, fallen by the sword, Who*ld caused terror in the land of the living.

“There*ln is*i Elam and all her multitude, All*ld around her grave, All*ld of them slain, fallen by the sword, Who*ld have gone down uncircumcised to the lower parts of the earth, Who*ld caused their terror in the land of the living; Now*ld they bear their shame with those who go down to the Pit.

They*ld have set her bed in the midst of the slain, With*ld all her multitude, With*ld her graves all around it, All*ld of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; Though*ld their terror was caused In*ld the land of the living, Yet*ld they bear their shame With*ld those who go down to the Pit; It*ld was put in the midst of the slain.

“There*ln are*i Meshech and Tubal and all their multitudes, With*ld all their graves around it, All*ld of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, Though*ld they caused their terror in the land of the living.

They*ld do not lie with the mighty Who*ild are*i fallen of the uncircumcised, Who*ld have gone down to hell with their weapons of war; They*ld have laid their swords under their heads, But*ld their iniquities will be on their bones, Because*ld of the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
Yes,*ld you shall be broken in the midst of the uncircumcised, And*ld lie with those*i slain by the sword.

“There*ln is*i Edom, Her*ld kings and all her princes, Who*ld despite their might Are*ld laid beside those*i slain by the sword; They*ld shall lie with the uncircumcised, And*ld with those who go down to the Pit.

There*ld are*i the princes of the north, All*ld of them, and all the Sidonians, Who*ld have gone down with the slain In*ld shame at the terror which they caused by their might; They*ld lie uncircumcised with those*i slain by the sword, And*ld bear their shame with those who go down to the Pit.
“Pharaoh*ln will see them And*ld be comforted over all his multitude, Pharaoh*ld and all his army, Slain*ld by the sword,” Says*ld the Lord God.*s

“For*ln I have caused My terror in the land of the living; And*ld he shall be placed in the midst of the uncircumcised With*ld those*i slain by the sword, Pharaoh*ld and all his multitude,” Says*ld the Lord God.*s
